pumapy.visualization package¶

Submodules¶

pumapy.visualization.render module¶

class pumapy.visualization.render.Renderer(workspace, render_type, scale, cutoff, color, representation, origin, window_size, background, sampled_points, displacement, stresses, color_by)[source]¶

Bases: object

convert_numpy_to_vtk()[source]¶
error_check()[source]¶
render()[source]¶
setup_paraview()[source]¶
pumapy.visualization.render.render_contour(workspace, threshold, color=False, origin=(0, 0, 0), window_size=(1229, 814), background=(0.1, 0.1, 0.1))[source]¶

Contour render using Paraview Contour filter

Parameters

  • workspace – (Workspace or ndarray) domain

  • threshold – (int, tuple(int,int)) specifying the value(s) to contour

  • color – (bool, optional) specifying whether to color it

  • origin – (tuple(int, int, int), optional) origin of the data

  • window_size – (tuple(int, int), optional) with the popup window size

  • background – (tuple(float, float, float)) color of the background from [0., 0., 0.] (black) to [1., 1., 1.] (white)

pumapy.visualization.render.render_orientation(workspace, arrowscale=None, samples=5000, origin=(0, 0, 0), window_size=(1229, 814), background=(0.1, 0.1, 0.1))[source]¶

Orientation render using Paraview Glyph filter

Parameters

  • workspace – (Workspace or ndarray) domain

  • arrowscale – (int, optional) specifying the scale of the arrows

  • samples – (int, optional) specifying the number of sampled points to plot arrows

  • origin – (tuple(int, int, int), optional) origin of the data

  • window_size – (tuple(int, int), optional) with the popup window size

  • background – (tuple(float, float, float)) color of the background from [0., 0., 0.] (black) to [1., 1., 1.] (white)

pumapy.visualization.render.render_volume(workspace, cutoff=None, color=False, representation='surface', origin=(0, 0, 0), window_size=(1229, 814), background=(0.1, 0.1, 0.1))[source]¶

Volume render using Paraview Threshold filter

Parameters

  • workspace – (Workspace or ndarray) domain

  • cutoff – (tuple(int, int), optional) specifying the values to render

  • color – (bool, optional) specifying whether to color it

  • representation – (string, optional) specifying the representation (‘surface’, ‘edges’, ‘wireframe’, ‘points’)

  • origin – (tuple(int, int, int), optional) origin of the data as

  • window_size – (tuple(int, int), optional) with the popup window size

  • background – (tuple(float, float, float)) color of the background from [0., 0., 0.] (black) to [1., 1., 1.] (white)

pumapy.visualization.render.render_warp(workspace, displacement, cutoff, scale=None, stresses=None, color_by='magnitude', representation='surface', origin=(0, 0, 0), window_size=(1229, 814), background=(0.1, 0.1, 0.1))[source]¶

Warping render using Paraview Warp filter

Parameters

  • workspace – (Workspace or ndarray) domain

  • displacement – (ndarray) with the displacement field with dims (x, y, z, 3) (output of compute_elasticity)

  • cutoff – (tuple(int, int), optional) specifying the values to render

  • scale – (float, optional) specifying the scale factor for warping

  • stresses – (ndarray, optional) with the displacement field with dims (x, y, z, 3) (output of compute_elasticity) used to color the domain

  • color_by – (string, optional) specifying how to color it (‘magnitude’, ‘x’, ‘y’, ‘z’)

  • representation – (string, optional) specifying the representation (‘surface’, ‘edges’, ‘wireframe’, ‘points’)

  • origin – (tuple(int, int, int), optional) origin of the data

  • window_size – (tuple(int, int), optional) with the popup window size

  • background – (tuple(float, float, float)) color of the background from [0., 0., 0.] (black) to [1., 1., 1.] (white)

pumapy.visualization.render_multiphase module¶

pumapy.visualization.render_multiphase.render_contour_multiphase(workspace, cutoffs, background=(1, 1, 1))[source]¶

Contour render for multi-phase materials using Paraview

Parameters

  • workspace – (Workspace or ndarray) domain

  • cutoffs – np.array of size (n,2) where n is the number of materials. specifies the low and high cutoff ranges

  • background – (tuple(float, float, float)) color of the background from [0., 0., 0.] (black) to [1., 1., 1.] (white)

update()[source]¶
pumapy.visualization.slicer.compare_slices(ws_nparray1, ws_nparray2, slice_direction='z', crange1=None, cmap1='gray', crange2=None, cmap2='gray', index=1)[source]¶

Plot slices of domain along a specified direction (z default)

Parameters

  • ws_nparray1 – (Workspace or ndarray) domain

  • ws_nparray2 – (Workspace or ndarray) domain

  • slice_direction – (string) ‘x’, ‘y’, ‘z’

  • crange1 – (tuple(int, int)) specify min and max grayscale

  • cmap1 – (string) color map for the plot, ‘gray’ (default), ‘jet’ or refer to matplotlib for other colormaps

  • crange2 – (tuple(int, int)) specify min and max grayscale

  • cmap2 – (string) color map for the plot, ‘gray’ (default), ‘jet’ or refer to matplotlib for other colormaps

  • index – (int) specifying the slice index in which the plot will be opened

pumapy.visualization.slicer.plot_slices(ws_nparray, slice_direction='z', crange=None, cmap='gray', index=1)[source]¶

Plot slices of domain along a specified direction (z default)

Parameters

  • ws_nparray – (Workspace or ndarray) domain

  • slice_direction – (string) ‘x’, ‘y’, ‘z’

  • crange – (tuple(int, int)) specify min and max grayscale

  • cmap – (string) color map for the plot, ‘gray’ (default), ‘jet’ or refer to matplotlib for other colormaps

  • index – (int) specifying the slice index in which the plot will be opened
